page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: {Monk Fryston and Hillam}are next to each other with{South Milford}two kilometres down the road and{Lumby}is also very near.Monk Fryston has got two pubs,the{Crown}and the{Bluebell}it also has a hall which is now an hotel. The places of worship are{St.Wilfrid's {Church}and the{Methodist Chapel.}There is a Farm shop,two hairdressers and a Post Office.Many of the houses are quite old,some dating back to the sixteenth century.South Milford has a Post Office,fish and chip shop,cycle shop,butchers and hairdressers.The {Black Bull,Swan,Queen O'T'Owd Thatch and 3 Feathers are the 4 pubs.There is a cricket ground and a public playing field,an{Anglican Church}and a {Methodist Church.}Lumby is the smallest village of the four,having no shops,it is a mainly farming village with only a few houses.
